intro: Helianthemum viscidulum subsp. guadiccianum, commonly known as the Guadiccián rock rose, is a low-growing shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its dense, sticky foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in rocky and limestone soils, often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. It is well adapted to Mediterranean climates with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers.
